CIRCULAR No.  22 / 2004 
 
 
Subject   :- 
Security/Guarding of Non-operational Airports 
 
 
The security of non-operational airports is as important as that of operational airports in the 
country, in view of fast changing Aviation Security scenario all over the world. This matter has 
been examined in the Indian perspective and the following instructions are issued for 
implementation by all concerned with immediate effect. 
 
i. 
State Police will be deployed for guarding/security of Non-operational airports, 
categorized as  Hyper-sensitive/Sensitive.  In case the State Police cannot spare adequate 
manpower & equipment for it, the airport operator will deploy CISF at such airports. 
 
ii. 
AAI/Airport Operator will deploy watch & ward staff for guarding/security of Non-
operational airports, categorized as Normal ; and 
 
iii. 
Director (Security) AAI will work out strength of CISF / State Police/Watch & ward 
staff, as the case may be, in consultation with BCAS. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
( D. P. Dahiya ) 
Dy. Commissioner of Security (CA) 
 
Distribution :  As per standard list.
